Reviews.Title: “A comfortable and clean hotel”
Reviews.Author: Judiza_2012
Reviews.Content: Hotel Sisto V is a comfortable and clean hotel with very nice updated bathrooms. It is not a resort type of hotel with a lot of amenities but offers a good base when returning from a full day of sightseeing. The hotel is located in the north west section of Rome....more suburbia than city. There are shops and a pharmacy within walking distance. I found my double room to be peaceful and quiet despite the fact the hotel is near a train station and hospital, To get to the center of Rome where most of the historic sites are we took a taxi to Cornelia Metro Station which passes through most important sites. The staff are helpful and speak English quite well. Good value for money. Would have been nice if there were some coffee/tea making facilities in the rooms especially as there is no restaurant or bar.

Reviews.Title: “Poor hotel, far from center”
Reviews.Author: ytrewq2000
Reviews.Content: May be some people like this place but we didn't. Some reasons: - bad value for money - rooms are old, especially WCs - very Far from city center, we spent about 40 min by light train. My advise - look for the places closer to the city center.

Reviews.Title: “very good value for money”
Reviews.Author: sally h
Reviews.Content: Although the hotel is a little far out of town I thought it was excellent value for money. The only downside was the breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “Far from the center and close to the Vatican”
Reviews.Author: Tiago2635
Reviews.Content: The hotel is far from the center, there are few public transport at night, and my room was very small. The breakfast was ok, and the employees were friendly, but had some problems speaking English. The Hotel Sisto V is close to the Vatican I recommend a hotel closer to the center.

Reviews.Title: “Poor location; nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: phil2u
Reviews.Content: I had to book a hotel in Rome at the last minute and found it difficult to locate something affordable with available rooms. A friend suggested this hotel as it is located in his neighborhood. It has been recently renovated and the rooms are spacious, clean and well appointed. The bathrooms are modern and above average for Europe. It is unfortunately located in a residential area and too far from the sites of Rome. I discovered the bus stops just steps away, however, and there is also a train station within a couple of blocks, so one can make an easy connection to the metro system. The worst disadvantage for me is that there are literally no restaurants within walking distance. There are several pizzarias and small markets, but one has to travel by bus or taxi to get to a decent restaurant. The breakfast was quite poor for this class hotel - instant coffee dispensed from a machine, watery juices, poor quality commercial pastries, etc. They did have boiled eggs on one of the three mornings I was there. The staff was great! They were very friendly and very helpful with information about bus routes, getting tickets, finding food, etc. There is a garage, but it is not free.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel, be aware of train(FS) hours”
Reviews.Content: Hotel is good in general, staff speak English and are helpful. We started using the train to get us to the metro and then to Rome Center, but we noticed reduced hours after 7PM and on weekends, I think there are 2 trains per hour after 7PM and 1 per hour after 9PM, same kind of problems during the week end. So use the bus instead, two buses take you to the metro, they are always there, just avoid them on rush hour. Also be aware that it takes about 45min to go from the hotel to Rome Center ( Coleseum for instance ), it is a big city so this is normal, just take this into consideration.

Reviews.Title: “Not For The Light Sleepers!!”
Reviews.Author: AnnaLouiseTwin
Reviews.Content: On the main thoroughway to the main hospital so do not book if you like nice peaceful sleeps! Close to Metro and just two stops away from Vatican though, so pretty handy if you are driving.No restaurant. No Bar. No additional facilities, very basic. Breakfast was not all that good.

Reviews.Title: “a clean and comfortable hotel with good links to rome city centre”
Reviews.Author: rabinorabbit
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here with our 2 children (aged 6 & 7). The room was clean and had a lovely balcolny. There was little for our children to do- no kids channels on the tv, but there was a little lounge area where they could sit and play - we brought our own packs of cards. Unfortunatley the air con broke on 2nd night and it did get hot. There is a supermarket just around the corner which was great for stocking up on pizzas, bottles of water, bread, biscuits etc. These picnics saved us a fortune and were worth carrying. The bus service in to Cornelia and then on to the metro was a lot quicker and more frequent than the train. The hotel staff were friendly,but not particurlarly helpful - Another family who we met there told us about the supermarked and the bus. Breakfast was ok but did run out of some stuff - ham and cheese, bowls! on some days

HotelInfo.Name: Hotel Sisto V
HotelInfo.Address: Via Lardaria 10, 00168 Rome, Italy
